message.content:
<<<api>>>: File.createNewFile
<<<code>>>: File file = new File(context.getFilesDir(), "jokesBody1.bjk");
try{
    if(!file.exists()){
        file.createNewFile();
    }
    ObjectInputStream ois = new ObjectInputStream( new FileInputStream( file ) );
    try {
        list = (ArrayList)ois.readObject();
    } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
    ois.close();
} catch (IOException e) {
    Log.e("log activity", "Can not read file: " + e.toString());
}
<<<explanation>>>: The error message "EROFS (Read-only file system)" suggests that you're trying to create a new file in a read-only directory. In Android, you should use context.getFilesDir() to get the path to the directory where you can write files. Also, you should check if the file exists before trying to create it.
